channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Japan's Takaichi to pursue conservative agenda after election landslide
item.description: Japan's first female Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, brought the ruling Liberal Democratic Party its biggest-ever electoral victory, fueling her ambitions to pursue to a political agenda which she says could "split public opinion."
item.content:encoded:
Japan's first female Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, brought the ruling Liberal Democratic Party its biggest-ever electoral victory, fueling her ambitions to pursue to a political agenda which she says could "split public opinion."

(Image credit: Keisuke Hosojima)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Japan's ruling party wins a supermajority in country's lower house
item.description: Japan's ruling party scored its biggest electoral win in its seven-decade history Sunday, due mostly to the popularity of its first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi.
item.content:encoded: Japan's ruling party scored its biggest electoral win in its seven-decade history Sunday, due mostly to the popularity of its first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Ukrainian president says US set June deadline for Russia and Ukraine to end war
item.description: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said the U.S. has set a June deadline for Kyiv and Moscow to end the war, even as Washington and Russia discuss $12 trillion in economic deals that could affect Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said the U.S. has set a June deadline for Kyiv and Moscow to end the war, even as Washington and Russia discuss $12 trillion in economic deals that could affect Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in prison
item.description: A Hong Kong court sentenced 78-year-old activist and publisher Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after finding him guilty under China's national security law.
item.content:encoded: A Hong Kong court sentenced 78-year-old activist and publisher Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after finding him guilty under China's national security law.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Iran's crackdown on dissent widens to ensnare reformist figures
item.description: Detained Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi has received another prison sentence of over seven years.
item.content:encoded:
Detained Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi has received another prison sentence of over seven years.

(Image credit: Narges Foundation Archive)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: China critic and former media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in Hong Kong
item.description: Jimmy Lai, the pro-democracy former Hong Kong media tycoon and a fierce critic of Beijing, was sentenced on Monday to 20 years in prison in the longest punishment given so far under a China-imposed national security law that has virtually silenced the city's dissent.
item.content:encoded:
Jimmy Lai, the pro-democracy former Hong Kong media tycoon and a fierce critic of Beijing, was sentenced on Monday to 20 years in prison in the longest punishment given so far under a China-imposed national security law that has virtually silenced the city's dissent.

(Image credit: Vincent Yu)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Center-left Socialist candidate wins over populist in Portugal's presidential runoff
item.description: Center-left Socialist candidate António José Seguro recorded a thumping victory over hard-right populist André Ventura in Portugal's runoff presidential election Sunday, according to official results.
item.content:encoded:
Center-left Socialist candidate António José Seguro recorded a thumping victory over hard-right populist André Ventura in Portugal's runoff presidential election Sunday, according to official results.

(Image credit: Ana Brigida)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S.-India trade deal improves relations, but strain still shows
item.description: After months of wrangling and much tension, India and the US have finally released a framework for an interim trade agreement
item.content:encoded: After months of wrangling and much tension, India and the US have finally released a framework for an interim trade agreement
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Investigating one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history
item.description: More than a week after one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history, many questions remain unanswered, and survivors struggle to move on.
item.content:encoded: More than a week after one of the worst train accidents in Spain's history, many questions remain unanswered, and survivors struggle to move on.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: U.S. gave Ukraine and Russia June deadline to reach peace agreement, Zelenskyy says
item.description: "The Americans are proposing the parties end the war by the beginning of this summer," Zelenskyy said, speaking to reporters on Friday.
item.content:encoded:
"The Americans are proposing the parties end the war by the beginning of this summer," Zelenskyy said, speaking to reporters on Friday.

(Image credit: Sergei Grits)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
